intro: Rinorea anguifera var. nervosa, commonly known as the veined rinorea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and unique growth habit.
